Title: FG backtracks on pardon as Nigerians question due process
Summary: FG backtracks on pardon as Nigerians question due process . President Bola Tinubu’s withdrawn pardon has spotlighted what observers describe as a troubling habit of governance by reversal .

Title: Service chiefs unveil ambitious plans at Senate confirmation
Summary: The Senate confirmed Nigeria’s four service chiefs-designate after marathon screening sessions in Abuja . Each nominee outlined ambitious plans at Senate confirmation .

Title: Reps approve Tinubu’s $2.34b loan, empower EFCC to seize assets without conviction
Summary: House of Representatives, yesterday, approved President Bola Ahmed Tinubu’s request to raise a total of $2.347 billion from the international . House also empowered EFCC to seize assets without conviction .

Title: Zamfara PDP reacts to lawmaker’s defection, says decision unwise
Summary: Zamfara State chapter of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has reacted to the defection of the member representing Maradun Constituency . PDP reacts to lawmaker’s defection, says decision unwise .

Title: Opaque oil incentives may cost Nigeria N6tr yearly, NEITI, CISLAC warn
Summary: Nigeria Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (NEITI) has warned that the country may lose up to N6 trillion yearly to unaccounted oil incentives . Nigeria's extractive industry may lose N6tr yearly, NEITI, CISLAC warn .

Title: NDOKWA-UKWUANI: NPN faults Ned Nwoko over Igbo claim
Summary: Socio-cultural group, Ndokwa Professional Network, NPN, disagreed with senator representing Delta North senatorial district, Ned Nwoko, over his comment . NPN faults senator representing . Delta North Senatorial district over his comments . The group said the people are Igbo and speak Igbo language .

Title: CDCFIB releases shortlist, sets date for recruitment CBT across Paramilitary agencies
Summary: CDCFIB releases shortlist for applicants who participated in its recent recruitment exercise . Nigerian Correctional Service NCOS, Nigeria Immigration Service NIS, Federal Fire Service FFS, and Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps NSCDC .

Title: FULafia appoints new vice-chancellor
Summary:
Prof. Mohammed Isa Kida has been appointed as the new Vice-Chancellor of the Federal University of Lafia (FULafia).
The post FULafia appoints new vice-chancellor appeared first on Vanguard News.

Title: FATF delisting: Nigerian manufacturers stand to gain substantially — MAN
Summary: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria welcomed the recent removal of Nigeria from the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) grey list . Director General of MAN, Segun Ajayi-Kadir, stated this in an exclusive interaction with Vanguard .

Title: GTCO’s PBT up 39% to N299 bn in Q3’25
Summary: Guaranty Trust Holding Holding Company Plc (GTCO) has released its unaudited third quarter results 2025, Q3’25 . GTCO reported Profit Before Tax, PBT of N299.9 billion, up 39% Year-on-Year, YoY . Gross earnings for the three-month period

Title: Board warns Nigerians against fake paramilitary recruitment messages
Summary: Civil Defence, Correctional, Fire and Immigration Services Board has warned Nigerians to beware of fraudulent recruitment messages circulating online, as the 2025 paramilitary recruitment exercise enters a crucial phase . In a statement posted on its official X handle late Wednesday, the board clarified that it will not contact applicants through email or SMS, stressing that all legitimate updates are available

Title: EXPLAINER: How new tax laws affect Nigerians abroad
Summary: The Presidential Fiscal Policy and Tax Reforms Committee has released detailed clarifications addressing concerns by Nigerians in the diaspora about the new tax reforms taking effect in 2026 . The material was disclosed in a material obtained by PUNCH Online on Thursday .

Title: Maresca slams Delap's ‘foolish’ red card in Chelsea EFL Cup win
Summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca labelled Liam Delap’s red card as ‘very stupid’ after his late dismissal overshadowed the Blues’ dramatic 4-3 Carabao Cup victory over Wolves . Delap, making his return from a 10-week hamstring lay-off, was sent off just 26 minutes after

Title: NSCDC deploys 10,000 personnel for Anambra gov poll
Summary: The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps has deployed over 10,000 operatives to ensure adequate security during the forthcoming Anambra State governorship election scheduled for November 8 . The move, according to the NSCDC spokesperson, Afolabi Babawale, is part of efforts to support the Nigeria Police Force, which is the lead agency

Title: Manufacturers record fragile growth as credit drops N7.72tn
Summary: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria said credit to the manufacturing sector decreased by 9.5 per cent to N7.72tn as of March 2025, down from N8.53tn in December 2024 . The report also indicated that 18,935 jobs were lost in the first half of 2025, compared to 10,891 in the
